resources.string: I hope you are liking Snorlax!\n\nIf you do, you can support this project to keep coming with new features by buying me a cup of coffee (so i can code by night) or a BigMac at McDonalds. Click the button below and thanks you (look at the end of the README file)!
This project is open source under the Apache 2.0 license. If you like this module, an star to this repo on my Github will help me a lot.
Special thanks for the github users chuparCh0pper for his PoGoIV_xposed project and ELynx for the method used to MITM PokemonGo communication.
Install Pokemon Go to launch it
%NICK% : Shows pokemon nickname if present, or pokemon name\n%NICK% -> Rainer\n%NICK% (no nickname) -> Vaporeon
%NICK.#% : Shows pokemon nickname if present, or trimmed pokemon name.\n%NICK.3% -> Rainer\n%NICK.3% (no nickname) -> Vap
%LVL% : Shows pokemon level with one decimal.\n%LVL% -> 2.5
%LVL.#% : Round up and trims pokemon level by # decimals.\n%LVL.0% -> 3\n%LVL.2% -> 2.50
%LVLP% : Same as %LVL% but add leading zeros.\n%LVLP% -> 02.5
%LVLP.#% : Same as %LVL.#% but add leading zeros.\n%LVLP.0% -> 03\n%LVLP.2% -> 02.50
%IV% : Shows pokemon iv with one decimal.\n%IV% -> 6.7
%IV.#% : Round up and trims pokemon iv by # decimals.\n%IV.0% -> 7\n%IV.2% -> 6.67
%IVP% : Same as %IV% but add leading zeros.\n%IVP% -> 006.7
%IVP.#% : Same as %IV.#% but add leading zeros.\n%IVP.0% -> 007\n%IVP.2% -> 006.67
%ATTP% : Shows pokemon attack with leading zero.\n%ATTP% -> 01
%ATTH% : Shows pokemon attack with hexadecimal format.\n%ATTH% (15) -> F
%DEFP% : Shows pokemon defense with leading zero.\n%DEFP% -> 01
%DEFH% : Shows pokemon defense with hexadecimal format.\n%DEFH% (15) -> F
%STAP% : Shows pokemon stamina with leading zero.\n%STAP% -> 01
%STAH% : Shows pokemon stamina with hexadecimal format.\n%STAH% (15) -> F

%CPL% : Shows pokemon CP if evolved to the last stage. Return ‚Äò?‚Äô if multiple evolutions are possibles.
%CPL% (Weedle) -> 2300
%CPL% (Kakuna) -> 2300
%CPL% (Beedrill) -> -
%CPL% (Eevee) -> ?
%MV1% : Shows pokemon fast attack.\n%MV1% -> Zen Headbutt
%MV2% : Shows pokemon charge attack.\n%MV2% -> Seed bomb
%MV1.#% : Trims pokemon fast attack by #.\n%MV1.3% -> Zen
%MV2.#% : Trims pokemon charge attack by #.\n%MV2.3% -> See
%MVT1% : Shows pokemon fast attack type.\n%MVT1% -> Psychic
%MVT2% : Shows pokemon charge attack type.\n%MVT2% -> Grass
%MVT1.#% : Trims pokemon fast attack type by #.\n%MVT1.3% -> Psy
%MVT2.#% : Trims pokemon charge attack type by #.\n%MVT2.3% -> Gra
%MVP1P% : Shows pokemon fast attack power with leading zero.\n%MVP1P% -> 012
%MVP2P% : Shows pokemon charge attack power with leading zero.\n%MVP2P% -> 040
%TYP1.#% : Trims pokemon first type by #.\n%TYP1.3% -> Nor
%TYP2.#% : Trims pokemon second type by #.\n%TYP2.3% -> Ele
Note: Snorlax wont format other that the above commands. This means that you could add a ‚Äò%‚Äô next to the Iv like this:\n%IV%% -> 6.7%
